abstract: United Nations high commissioner for human rights Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein calls on Turkey to investigate report that its army shot unarmed civilians in southeastern town of Cizre, which is predominantly Kurdish; al-Hussein also raises concerns about crackdown on news media and critics of government.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Europe; Turkey: Concerns on Reported Shooting and the Harsh Treatment of Journalists
headline.main: U.N. Rights Chief Urges Turkey to Investigate Shooting of Civilians

snippet: Two were said to have been killed when troops appeared to open fire on an unarmed group about 10 days ago. The wounded included a journalist who filmed the episode.
lead_paragraph: Two were said to have been killed when troops appeared to open fire on an unarmed group about 10 days ago. The wounded included a journalist who filmed the episode.
